data.title: Horrible!!!!
data.text: Where should I start? This hotel usually books at $69 a night. For graduation week they charged over $200 a night. My 2 night stay was $560. OMG!!! Flithy, wouldn't take a shower there if they paid me! Dark inside because they don't want you to know what it really looks like. Noisy people with lots of cussing, I think they rent by the week and month. Would not recommend  this place to anyone! Stay away!!! Big hole behind the door, rust in the bathroom, toilet barely flushed, bathroom fan didn't work was all rusted. Dirty walls and doors. Just plain dirty!!!

owner_response.author: htlboss, Front Office Manager at University Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We deeply apologize for your unpleasant experience while staying at University Inn. Unfortunately graduation weekend is a very busy time for us as well as a cause for celebration among other guests. Please rest assure that we are doing our very best in maintaining a friendly and clean environment.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Chico Testing for Jessika
data.text: The room was filthy.  The TV didn't work. I was leery of sleeping in the bed so I sprayed it with Lysol.  The bathroom floor was dirty.  The amenities were laughable. The micro pillows looked ridiculous on the king bed.  I wouldn't stay here again even if it meant that I would have to sleep in my car.

owner_response.author: htlboss, Front Office Manager at University Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We deeply apologize for your unpleasant experience while staying at University Inn. Rest assure our rooms are cleaned daily by our housekeeping department and we are working hard to remodel and freshen up our rooms for future guest to ensure a positive experience. Again we apologize your experience while staying at the University Inn.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: So bad I left
data.text: I don't know how I missed the terrible reviews that came before me, but somehow I found myself in room 223 of this motel. The room had a weird unlatched door (in that it had no locking mechanism) that opened onto a utility closet that opened to the outside through an unlocked door. The room smelled of stale pot smoke. I felt that the unlockable door was a dealbreaker, so I demanded a cancellation (thanks, hotels.com customer service!) and moved to a better, locked-door-having hotel.

owner_response.author: htlboss, Front Office Manager at University Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: We deeply apologize for your unpleasant experience while staying at University Inn. Our management team is very responsive to guest issues and complaints and we could have resolved the issue in a timely manner. We ask that you give us another chance if you are ever in Chico again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Dirty
data.text: Dirty room.  Stay away.  Stinky.  It was dark and late when I checked it.  Didn't realize what I had done until morning.  Great place for deer hunters, coal miners, well drillers and camel hearders.  Not for you.

data.title: Easy to book, easy to get to.
data.text: I booked this hotel somewhat last minute to go up to Chico for a friend's birthday. The room was clean, the hotel is easy to find and easily accessible, and it's the perfect location in downtown for walking to and from.

data.title: SO GROSS!
data.text: There was a group of people hanging out in the parking lot, smoking and drinking right outside my window until 2 in the morning. The room was filthy, with nasty carpets, graffiti on the walls in the room; the furniture was damaged (chair was super gross); toilet was not properly attached to the floor so it rocked when you sat on it and the bathroom is SO SMALL (no room to even turn to wipe your rear). The bedding was super cheap and flimsy. Not enough outlets in the room. Wifi was so slow, so I couldn't do any of the schoolwork I needed to. I could go on. The only good thing was how close it was to Chico State Uni. The cost is definitely not low enough to justify how horrible and gross this place is.

data.title: Disgusting
data.text: The health department should consider shutting this place down. First, there was no smoke detector in the room. This is a violation of state law. The room smelled terrible from cigarette smoke and we had to immediately wash our clothes upon returning home. There were bugs in the bathroom. The vent in the bathroom had wads of toilet paper stuck inside. There was graffiti painted on the shelf of the clothes rack. The bedside lamp was unplugged, but the cord would not reach the outlet, so it's useless. The clock radio did not work, so why even have it there? We mentioned these issues to the housekeeper who said that she had no idea. Really??? This place felt dirty. The only positive thing I can say is that the office clerk was very friendly. She would do well at a much better hotel.

data.title: Very Dirty
data.text: I wish that the University Inn was better for those folks who have kids attending Chico State but it was really bad. It is very dirty and the rooms smelled like smoke. I'm not sure what room is on the front of the website, but the rooms we saw were nothing like that they were both the same, filthy!

data.title: Management is accomodating, refurbished, great location!
data.text: Super friendly!  They let me check in extra early.  I have a fridge, micro, tv, clock, new carpet, 2 double beds, 6 great pillows, and it is right downtown!   I have stayed at many fancy hotels.  This is not a fancy hotel, this is Chico! And for the price and location... It's good!  I would stay again! Also they have coffee, tea, oatmeal, etc all day.  I think they deserve higher ratings.  They do now anyway.

data.title: So bad we left, and drove home 6 hours to avoid being killed there.
data.text: Worst hotel I think I've ever experienced.  Took a shower, went to dinner and returned to the feel of a shanty town.  Packed my bag and our group left instead of staying there.  Asked for a refund and one was not granted.  Disgusting.

data.title: Makes a flop house look like the Ritz!
data.text: I have traveled the globe and visited some of the poorest villages imaginable. Never in my whole life have I ever come across a place this bad. The smell of cigarettes, body odor, and pot hit you in the parking lot, and don't stop. Cockroaches are everywhere, but if you are careful you can step over them as you enter your room. Rooms are rented before they have even been cleaned! If you are lonely, looks like a place to meet your hourly rate companion; As there appeared to be one hanging around the property (including the tiny check-in lobby) when I tried to stay here. The "desk clerk" (and I use that term loosely) was smug, deceitful, and does not appear trustworthy at all (at least after I caught him trying to pull a fast one on me). I don't know why the local police and health department haven't shut this place down!

data.title: Very dodgy!
data.text: Say no more, just VERY dodgy! The location is okay, room looks okay, but aircon doesn't work properly beds are saggy, looks like whoever made the beds just threw the pillows on the beds. The receptionist was grumpy, carpets dirty, and to add insult to injury, it's not cheap, this quality I'd expect to pay say $45.00 but this room cost me $100.00.

owner_response.author: htlboss, Owner at University Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I want for you to always have a quality, comfortable stay with us, 33Wren33. We do have a very stringent policy for keeping our rooms in top condition, so I'm disappointed that you left feeling underwhelmed. Your receptionist needs to be ready to address your concerns and make things right for you. I'll address these issues with my staff. Please know we'd jump at another opportunity to show you our best.

All the best,
Mohammad, Owner
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Roaches
data.text: There were holes in the wall and I found multiple cockroaches in the room. The ice machine was next to room and was leaking water everywhere.water pressure was bad. the continental breakfast was instant and bad coffee.

owner_response.author: htlboss, Owner at University Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Daisy, we take pest control and cleanliness very seriously, so I'm surprised to read this. Although what you described is very abnormal here, we're always happy to address any issue you have at the front desk and make things right. If we can take care of these rare occurrences as soon as possible, we can better ensure that the rest of your stay will be much more comfortable. I'd like to follow up on this with you. If you'd like to share the dates of your visit and discuss further, please give me a call at (530) 895-1323.

All the best,
Mohammad, Owner
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: OMG... Hideous
data.text: There aren't many hotels that top the level of disgusting that the Extended Stay America has to offer, but this one really takes the cake. We were not the only people in our party staying at this hotel and when they rolled up at the check in time none of the rooms were ready. They came back an hour later and still none of the rooms were ready. The first thing that you notice when it being assigned your room on the second floor is that they have never ever ever ever cleaned the staircase the railings or the floor. its disgusting. We got into our room and none of the light fixtures worked. Not just the bulbs were burned out, the actual fixtures were broken. The curtains were falling down, the coaxial cable in the back the television was bad so you got absolutely no signal, and the furniture was just dirty. But nothing can top the dead cockroach that I found in my bed after having slept in it. I highly advise you not to stay here.

owner_response.author: htlboss, Owner at University Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
It's disappointing to hear we didn't leave a better impression on you! However, after reading your review, I can certainly understand why. Can you tell me what room you stayed in? I'd like to personally take a look at it as soon as possible so I can make sure it's guest-ready.

Sincerely,
Mohammad, Owner
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Disgusting
data.text: If you are ok with mold in the fridge, dirty furniture,filthy baseboards and bubbled ceiling that could full on you, this is the place to go. I paid $452.08 for 2 nights, May 2014, managed to get a refund of $50 whoopy should have been more like $400.

owner_response.author: htlboss, Owner at University Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for following up with us after your stay, Linda. The last thing we want is for any of our guests to leave frustrated, but I certainly understand where you're coming from. I really appreciate you speaking up about the problems with your room when you were here; please know that we're working on addressing these issues!

Sincerely,
Mohammad, Owner
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Someone should burn this place down!
data.text: Unless you like cockroaches, dont come here! The rooms were DISGUSTING as well as the shower. I wish i would have slept in my car. All they have is instant coffee and its NOT in your room. The towels were straight nasty. I dont think the clerk at the front desk even knew how to speak english. There were gangsters and prostitutes outside asking where the nearest motel 6 was so they could "do the deed." There were tweakers upstairs blasting country music during the early hours of the morning. Im pretty sure the beds gave me gonorrhea. I hated it! Dont come here!!! Not worth it.

owner_response.author: htlboss, Owner at University Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I'm certainly sorry to hear you were so put off by your stay at our inn, but I appreciate you taking the time to let me know what you think. Nothing is more important to us than our guests' health and safety, so the last thing we want is for anyone to feel uncomfortable in our rooms. Please know that I plan on sharing your feedback with our housekeeping and maintenance staffs; it'll serve as an important reminder that we can always do better!

Sincerely,
Mohammad, Owner
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A Basic, Fair Deal
data.text:
OK, so it's not Marriott or Starwood, but then if you could afford those you wouldn't be reading this.

I can't explain the bad reviews --- maybe I lucked up with the nicest room.
I certainly didn't feel "ripped off."

Run by a very friendly (to me, anyway) family led by Mohommad, the Vagabond Inn Chico presents a clean, basic accommodation at a MUCH cheaper rate than the nearby Courtyard and Residence Inns by Marriott. Of course the furnishings aren't as nice either, being a bit older & more warn. But the bed was very comfortably, the linens clean.

While there's a similar class motel across Main Street probably at competitive rates, that one doesn't have the clean, well, kept pool that sets Vagabond just a notch higher. 

Franchise-run operations can be disappointing, and I had some disappointing experiences with some of them, but not this one. Mohommad & family do a great job making the daily rounds and ensuring guests have what they need.

This is an older motel, so there will be the predicable maintenance snafu (my window wouldn't close completely, leaving a half-inch gap) but, again for the price -- not unreasonable. For the most part, the paint & paper are fresh, the carpets vacuumed, and the plumbing all in working condition.

One drawback are any celebratory weekends --- Chico is a college town, and big enough to get road show Pop/Rock band appearances, and when the kids come in for weekend party/show visits, the cost-effective motel gem fills up. And the kids come & go all night and gather in the parking lot with some loud conversation. 

To their credit, when I stuck my head out & asked them to keep it down, they cooperated without animosity. During the weekday nights, all was quiet, but for the weekends I would suggest to Mohammad that he put a watchman on to ride herd on the weekend riots.

owner_response.author: htlboss, Owner at University Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
That's a great idea, Harquer! Thanks for pointing to the noise on busy weekends in your review. We're always looking for ways we can improve the overall guest experience, and having someone on hand to patrol our parking lot, etc., at night is certainly a way to do that. If you have any other helpful suggestions, feel free to send them my way!

Thanks again,
Mohammad
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: RIP OFF ARTISTS!
data.text: The Vagabond Inn is probably the WORST hotel I've ever stayed at! Granted the room itself was fairly decent, even though the toilet leaked everywhere. The main problem was the service. My husband and I have been stranded in California because our car and money were stolen. We had a little over $160.00 left when we came to the Vegabond Inn for 2 nights. They said they had smoking rooms available with a fridge and a microwave which is what I reserved over the phone. We I got there and the young man behind the counter didn't speak English at all. He had to run get his father. Then they said that they didn't have any smoking room; a minor annoyance but we were tired and went with it, we didn't mind smoking outside with the beautiful weather. When we got to the room there was no fridge, no microwave, and only 20 channels on the TV. Later on, I was checking my debit card statement online and on top of charging me for the normal price of a room with the fridge, they placed a $50 deposit on my card which I knew NOTHING about. It was never even mentioned to me and is nowhere on their website. The people who ran the place told me that my card would only be charged if we smoked in the room (WHICH WE DIDN'T DO). When we checked out, we made sure that he didn't smell smoke and he agreed that there was no smoke smell and the money should be back on that day. It's been over 36 hours and the last $50 I had to my name is STILL not on my debit card. The reciept they gave me didn't have any mention of a charge. The customer service people for the company also have yet to return my calls. Another man also had a smilar  problem. He was charged $100 and smoked outside his room. Though he did leave the AC running and the door open, he didn't actually smoke inside the room. The poor man even called the police regarding this problem and was still made to pay. I do think that the staff could have spoken to him regarding smoking with the door open instead of ignoring it and charging him for nearly the same price of a 2 night stay. These people take advantage of people who have been in bad situations. Meth is smoked freely INSIDE those hotel rooms and they aren't charged extra, but cigarette smokers are charged rediculous amounts even when rules are followed.

owner_response.author: htlboss, Owner at University Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Rest assured that we would never, under any circumstances, take advantage of our guests, nor do we tolerate drug use on our property. While I am sorry for the confusion the $50 charge caused, I want you to know we in no way meant to confuse or frustrate you. I apologize if you felt like we were trying to pull the wool over your eyes; I guarantee that wasn't our intention.

Has the money been refunded to your debit card? If not, please give me a call; I'm committed to making sure this issue gets resolved.

Sincerely,
Mohammad, Owner
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Only One Night...
data.text: My son and I stayed just one night while visiting the college campus. The service was good and the room was clean. The only complaint was that the toilet was a little low and wiggled, but no other complaints. I will definitely stay there when I come to visit!

owner_response.author: htlboss, Owner at University Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for staying with us, Leslie! I appreciate you reminding us about the problems you had with your toilet. I think you'll be happy to hear our staff has since taken care of it!

Until next time,
Mohammad, Owner
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: bed bug infested, meth and prostitution, transients favorate
data.text: Yes, it was an unfortunate experience.  For the same cost, I went around the corner to Heritage Inn.  Microwave, refrigerator, and a lot more than just warm water and packets of instant coffee, and cellophane snacks for breakfast.  My friends in town kidded me for staying at the Vagabond, apparently this place was a dump in the 80's when we were college students and I didn't even know.  I'm sorry my 16 year old daughter had to see this place.  We WERE going to check out Chico College but now she's seen too much.

owner_response.author: htlboss, Owner at University Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I'm sorry to hear that too, Loisann. We consider ours a great place to stay in Chico, so the last thing we want is for anyone to get the wrong impression of our standards and values. Although I'm disappointed we ultimately lost your business, I appreciate your candid feedback; I know it will only help us to improve.

Regards,
Mohammad, Owner
owner_response.title: Owner Response
